About this capture
COLLECTED BY
Organization: Internet Archive
The Internet Archive discovers and captures web pages through many different web crawls. At any given time several distinct crawls are running, some for months, and some every day or longer. View the web archive through the Wayback Machine.
Collection: Wide Crawl Number 17: Started August 3rd, 2018
Wide17 was seeded with the "Total Domains" list of 256,796,456 URLs provided by Domains Index on June 26th, and crawled with max-hops set to "3" and de-duplication set "on".
  
TIMESTAMPS
The Wayback Machine - https://web.archive.org/web/20190413064300/http://www.xsquawkbox.net/xpsdk/docs/DataRefs.html

acf_takeoff_trimfloat825+yes[-1..1]This is the trim position for takeoff expressed as a ratio, 1 = max up trim, -1 = max down trim.
acf_min_trim_elevfloat825+yes[0..1]Maximum nose-down trim, expressed as a ratio of maximum nose-down elevator deflection
acf_max_trim_elevfloat825+yes[0..1]Maximum nose-up trim, expressed as a ratio of maximum nose-up elevator deflection
acf_elev_trim_speedratfloat825+yesratioThis is the speed of trim time, expressed as a ratio, where 1.0 means it takes 20 seconds to fully move trim from one extreme to the other. 2.0 means trim is twice as fast.
acf_elev_tabfloat825+yes[-1..1]This is the amount of elevator deflection (as a ratio of max) induced by the aerodynamic effect of static trim tabs.
acf_min_trim_ailnfloat825+yes[0..1]Maximum aileron downward trim, expressed as a ratio of maximum aileron downward travel
acf_max_trim_ailnfloat825+yes[0..1]Maximum aileron upward trim, expressed as a ratio of maximum aileron upward travel
acf_ailn_trim_speedratfloat825+yesratioThis is the speed of trim time, expressed as a ratio, where 1.0 means it takes 20 seconds to fully move trim from one extreme to the other. 2.0 means trim is twice as fast.
acf_ailn_tabfloat825+yes[-1..1]This is the amount of aileron deflection (as a ratio of max) induced by the aerodynamic effect of static trim tabs.
acf_min_trim_ruddfloat825+yes[0..1]Maximum rudder left trim, expressed as a ratio of maximum rudder left travel
acf_max_trim_ruddfloat825+yes[0..1]Maximum rudder right trim, expressed as a ratio of maximum rudder right travel
acf_rudd_trim_speedratfloat825+yesratioThis is the speed of trim time, expressed as a ratio, where 1.0 means it takes 20 seconds to fully move trim from one extreme to the other. 2.0 means trim is twice as fast.
acf_rudd_tabfloat825+yes[0..1]This is the amount of rudder deflection (as a ratio of max) induced by the aerodynamic effect of static trim tabs.
acf_elev_def_timefloat1000+yessecs Enter 0.0 to be able to deflect the controls as fast as the pilot can move the stick or the art stab system can command a deflection. If the plane has a hydraulic system and a max rate of control deflection, though, enter how long it takes to go from center tofully-deflected.
acf_ailn_def_timefloat1000+yessecs Enter 0.0 to be able to deflect the controls as fast as the pilot can move the stick or the art stab system can command a deflection. If the plane has a hydraulic system and a max rate of control deflection, though, enter how long it takes to go from center tofully-deflected.
acf_rudd_def_timefloat1000+yessecs Enter 0.0 to be able to deflect the controls as fast as the pilot can move the stick or the art stab system can command a deflection. If the plane has a hydraulic system and a max rate of control deflection, though, enter how long it takes to go from center tofully-deflected.
acf_elev_trim_timefloat1000+yessecs This is the total time taken for the elevator trim to go from one extreme to theother.
acf_ailn_trim_timefloat1000+yessecs This is the total time taken for the aileron trim to go from one extreme to theother.
acf_rudd_trim_timefloat1000+yessecs This is the total time taken for the rudder trim to go from one extreme to theother.
acf_speedbrake_ext_timefloat1000+yessecs Speedbrake time toextend.
acf_speedbrake_ret_timefloat1000+yessecs Speedbrake time toretract.

adf2_freq_hzint660+yes10HzThe current frequency of the second automatic direction finder.

NOTE: X-Plane does not currently feature a flip-flop standalone DME instrument, but the data exists.

+ sim/cockpit/warnings/

Caution and warnings are masters for annunciators by type. Master accept is lit for any warning or caution, so it is a catch-all. Use warnings/annunciators to see if the indicator is lit. Use the command-system to actuate changes to the annunciators.

ECAM_warning_onint660-922yesbooelanIs there a warning lit on the ECAM
warning_suppression_timeoutfloat660-922yessecondsTime when master warning goes on again (after supression)
master_caution_timeoutfloat660+yessecondsTime master caution will go out. (Use command-system instead of this dataref.)
master_caution_onfloat660+yesbooleanMaster caution is enabled for being lit (because it is not pressed)
master_warning_onfloat930+yesbooleanMaster warning is enabled for being lit (because it is not pressed)
master_accept_onfloat660+yesbooleanMaster accept is enabled for being lit (because it is not pressed)

annunciator_test_pressedint930+nobooleanTrue if the annunciator test button is pressed now.
autopilot_test_all_onint940-940nobooleanAll autopilot annunciators are on as part of the self test
autopilot_test_beepingint940+nobooleanThe autopilot is beeping as part of its self-test
autopilot_test_modes_litint941+nobooleanThe autopilot mode lights are on as part of its self test
autopilot_test_trim_litint941+nobooleanThe autopilot trim lights are on as part of its self test
autopilot_test_ap_litint941+nobooleanThe autopilot engaged lights are on as part of their self test

+ sim/flightmodel/

+ sim/flightmodel/controls/

sbrkratfloat660+yes[0..1.5]Actual speed brake deployment [0..1 = schedule for in-air, 1..1.5 = extra deployment when on ground]
flaprqstfloat660+yes[0..1]Requested flap deployment, 0 = off, 1 = max
slatrqstfloat660-799yesratioRequested Slat deployment - note that in XP8 you cannot independently control slats.
tail_lock_ratfloat850+yesratioThis is how locked the tail-wheel is ... 0 is free castoring, 1 is locked.
ail_trimfloat660+yes[-1..1]Current Aileron Trim, -1 = max left, 1 = max right
distfloat660+yesmetersDistance Traveled
elv_trimfloat660+yes[-1..1]Elevation Trim, -1 = max nose down, 1 = max nose up
flapratfloat660+yes[0..1]Actual flap 1 deployment ratio
flap2ratfloat660+yes[0..1]Actual flap 2 deployment ratio

+ sim/flightmodel/forces/

fside_aerofloat660+noNewtonsAerodynamic forces - sideways - ACF X
fnrml_aerofloat660+noNewtonsAerodynamic forces - upward - ACF Y
faxil_aerofloat660+noNewtonsAerodynamic forces - backward - ACF Z
fside_propfloat660+yesNewtonsforce sideways by all engines on the ACF. Override with override_engines
fnrml_propfloat660+yesNewtonsforce upward by all engines on the ACF. Override with override_engines Writable in v10 only
faxil_propfloat660+yesNewtonsforce backward by all engines on the ACF (usually this is a negative number). Override with override_engines
fside_gearfloat660+noNewtonsGear/ground forces - sideways - ACF X
fnrml_gearfloat660+noNewtonsGear/ground forces - upward - ACF Y
faxil_gearfloat660+noNewtonsGear/ground forces - backward - ACF Z
fside_totalfloat1000+yesNewtonstotal/ground forces - ACF X axis. Override with override_forces
fnrml_totalfloat1000+yesNewtonsTotal/ground forces - ACF Y axis. Override with override_forces
faxil_totalfloat1000+yesNewtonstotal/ground forces - ACF Z axis. Override with override_forces
L_aerofloat1000+noNMThe roll moment due to aerodynamic forces - positive = right roll.
M_aerofloat1000+noNMThe pitch moment due to aerodynamic forces - positive = pitch up.
N_aerofloat1000+noNMThe yaw moment due to aerodynamic forces - positive = yaw right/clockwise.
L_propfloat1000+yesNMThe roll moment due to prop forces. Override with override_engines - positive = right roll.
M_propfloat1000+yesNMThe pitch moment due to prop forces. Override with override_engines - positive = pitch up.
N_propfloat1000+yesNMThe yaw moment due to prop forces. Override with override_engines - positive = yaw right/clockwise.
L_gearfloat1000+noNMThe roll moment due to gear forces - positive = right roll.
M_gearfloat1000+noNMThe pitch moment due to gear forces - positive = pitch up.
N_gearfloat1000+noNMThe yaw moment due to gear forces positive = yaw right/clockwise.
L_massfloat1000+noNMThe roll moment due to asymmetric loading - positive = right roll.
M_massfloat1000+noNMThe pitch moment due to asymmetric loading - positive = pitch up.
N_massfloat1000+noNMThe yaw moment due to asymmetric loading - positive = yaw right/clockwise.
L_totalfloat1000+yesNMThe roll moment total. Override with override_force - positive = right roll.
M_totalfloat1000+yesNMThe pitch moment total. Override with override_force - positive = pitch up.
N_totalfloat1000+yesNMThe yaw moment total. Override with override_forces - positive = yaw right/clockwise.
fside_plug_acffloat1030+yesNewtonsExtra plugin-provided sideways force (ACF X axis, positive pushes airplane to the right). ADD to this dataref to apply extra force.
fnrml_plug_acffloat1030+yesNewtonsExtra plugin-provided upward force (ACF Y axis, positive pushes airplane up). ADD to this dataref to apply extra force.
faxil_plug_acffloat1030+yesNewtonsExtra plugin-provided forward force. (ACF Z axis, positive pushes airplane backward). ADD to this dataref to apply extra force.
L_plug_acffloat1030+yesNMExtra plugin-provided roll moment - ADD to this dataref to apply extra force - positive = right roll.
M_plug_acffloat1030+yesNMExtra plugin-provided pitch moment - ADD to this dataref to apply extra force - positive = pitch up.
N_plug_acffloat1030+yesNMExtra plugin-provided yaw moment - ADD to this dataref to apply extra force - positive = yaw right/clockwise.
g_nrmlfloat660+noGsTotal g-forces on the plane as a multiple, downward
g_axilfloat660+noGsTotal g-forces on the plane as a multiple, along the plane
g_sidefloat660+noGsTotal g-forces on the plane as a multiple, sideways
vx_air_on_acffloat660+nomtr/secVelocity of air relative to airplane
vy_air_on_acffloat660+nomtr/secVelocity of air relative to airplane
vz_air_on_acffloat660+nomtr/secVelocity of air relative to airplane
vx_acf_axisfloat660+nomtr/secVelocity of aircraft in its own coordinate system
vy_acf_axisfloat660+nomtr/secVelocity of aircraft in its own coordinate system
vz_acf_axisfloat660+nomtr/secVelocity of aircraft in its own coordinate system

psifloat660+yesdegreesThe true heading of the aircraft in degrees from the Z axis - OpenGL coordinates

local_azfloat660+yesmtr/sec2The acceleration in local OGL coordinates

betafloat660+nodegreesThe heading relative to the flown path (yaw)
vpathfloat660+nodegreesThe pitch the aircraft actually flies. (vpath+alpha=theta)
hpathfloat660+nodegreesThe heading the aircraft actually flies. (hpath+beta=psi)

visibility_effective_mfloat660+nometers >= 0The effective visibility after framerate-protecting visibility reductions.
visibility_terrain_mfloat660+nometers >= 0The range of ground visibility. When above the clouds, only some of the ground terrain is actually drawn.
visibility_framerate_ratiofloat660+no[0.0 - 1.0]The ratio of the reported visibility to actually show for frame-rate protection. 1.0 means the user ses the reported visibility. Writable in v9, fixed in v10.
visibility_math_levelint660+yesenumThis used to indicate what level of 3-d force visualization was shown to the user in 3-d.
visibility_scalefloat660-899yesmultiplerThis used to be the ratio used to scale up 3-d aero-force visualization

plane1_latdouble715+nodegsPlane 1 Lat lon and elevation. NOTE: your plugin must set the plane's
plane1_londouble715+nodegsposition by writing x, y and z. Also if another plugin is updating plane
plane1_eldouble715+nometersposition then these will not be accurate unless the plane updates them.
plane1_v_xfloat715+yesm/sPlane 1 cartesian velocities. These may not be accurate if another plugin
plane1_v_yfloat715+yesm/sis controlling the plane andn ot updating this data. You cannot use these to
plane1_v_zfloat715+yesm/smanipulate the plane.

plane16_zdouble850+yesmetersPlane 16 z location
plane16_thefloat850+yesdegreesPlane 16 theta (pitch)
plane16_phifloat850+yesdegreesPlane 16 phi (roll)
plane16_psifloat850+yesdegreesPlane 16 psi (heading)
plane16_gear_deployfloat[10]850+yesratioPlane 16 gear deployment for 6 gear. 0 = up, 1 = down
plane16_flap_ratiofloat850+yesratioPlane 16 flap lowering 0 = clean, 1 = max flaps
plane16_flap_ratio2float850+yesratioPlane 16 flap lowering 0 = clean, 1 = max flaps
plane16_spoiler_ratiofloat850+yesratioPlane 16 spoiler ratio (0 = clean, 1 = max spoilers)
plane16_speedbrake_ratiofloat850+yesratioPlane 16 speed brake ratio (0 = clean, 1 = max speed brakes)
plane16_sla1_ratiofloat850+yesratioPlane 16 slat deployment ratio 0 = clean, 1 = max slats
plane16_wing_sweepfloat850+yesratioPlane 16 wing sweep, 0 = normal, 1 = most sweep
plane16_throttlefloat[8]850+yesratioPlane 16 Percent of max throttle per 8 engines (0 = none, 1 = full fwd, -1 = full reverse)
plane16_yolk_pitchfloat850+yesratioPlane 16 Commanded pitch (Legacy for compatibility - use sim/multiplayer/controls/yoke_pitch_ratio)
plane16_yolk_rollfloat850+yesratioPlane 16 Commanded roll (Legacy for compatibility - use sim/multiplayer/controls/yoke_roll_ratio)
plane16_yolk_yawfloat850+yesratioPlane 16 Commanded yaw (Legacy for compatibility - use sim/multiplayer/controls/yoke_heading_ratio)
plane16_latdouble850+yesdegsPlane 16 Lat lon and elevation. NOTE: your plugin must set the plane's
plane16_londouble850+yesdegsposition by writing x, y and z. Also if another plugin is updating plane
plane16_eldouble850+yesmetersposition then these will not be accurate unless the plane updates them.
plane16_v_xfloat850+yesm/sPlane 16 cartesian velocities. These may not be accurate if another plugin
plane16_v_yfloat850+yesm/sis controlling the plane andn ot updating this data. You cannot use these to
plane16_v_zfloat850+yesm/smanipulate the plane.

+ sim/network/dataout/

dump_next_cycleint660-931yesbooleanAre we dumping cycle data?
network_data_rateint660+yeshzRate to send data over UDP at
data_to_internetint[200]660+yesbooleanEnable data output of this data ref to internet
data_to_diskint[200]660+yesbooleanEnable data output of this data ref to disk file
data_to_graphint[200]660+yesbooleanEnable data output of this data ref to graph
data_to_screenint[200]660+yesbooleanEnable data output of this data ref to screen
dump_parts_propsint660+yesbooleanDump extra prop data to screen
dump_parts_wingsint660+yesbooleanDump wing prop data to screen
dump_parts_vstabsint660+yesbooleanDump vertical stabilizer prop data to screen
is_external_visualint930+nobooleanIs this machine running as an external visual for another X-Plane machine.
is_multiplayer_sessionint930+nobooleanIs this machine part of an x-plane built-in multiplayer session?
is_instructor_stationint930+noboolean Is this machine running in instructor-stationmode?
multiplayer_ipint[19]930+noipIP addresses of multiplayer players (or 0 if not in used in v10)
external_visual_ipint[20]930+noipIP addresses of external visuals (or 0 if not in use in v10). Dim 8 in v9.
track_external_visualint[20]1030+nobooleanTrue if this remote visual tracks the master's view changes
+ sim/network/misc/

opentransport_initedint660+nobooleanHas x-plane already inited Open Transport? YOU SHOULD NEVER USE THIS DATAREF!!!
connection_handshakeint660-700noenumStatus of connection, 0 = no connection, 1 = half up, 2 = all up
network_time_secfloat660+nosecondsThe current elapsed time synched across the network
+ sim/physics/

earth_mufloat660+nom^3/s^2The earth's mass-gravity constant
mars_mufloat660-700nom^3/s^2Mars's mass-gravity constant
earth_radius_mfloat660+nometersEarth's radius
mars_radius_mfloat660-700nometersMars' radius

mars_temp_cfloat660-700nocelsiusAverage sea level temp on Mars (sea?)
earth_pressure_pfloat660+nopascalsaverage pressure at sea level, current planet
mars_pressure_pfloat660-700nopascalsaverage pressure at sea level, mars
rho_sea_levelfloat660+no???rho at sea level, current planet
mu_airfloat660-840no???viscosity of air for Re determination
g_sealevelfloat660+no???gravitational acceleration of earth AT SEA LEVEL
pifloat660-817noradianspi - Austin sez plugins may no longer change the value of PI.
double_pifloat660-817noradianspi * 2
half_pifloat660-817noradianspi / 2
Rfloat660-817no???R (gas constant)
rho_waterfloat660+no???rho of water

+ sim/operation/g430/

These datarefs only apply to real, physical G430s, e.g. if you buy an expensive G430 and plug it into your PC! This is not for any _simulated_ system.

G430_is_vlocint[2]1030+nobooleanIf true, vertical guidance is a glide slope - otherwise it is a GPS vertical guidance indicator. Comes from the physical units!
+ sim/operation/misc/

debug_networkint660+yesbooleanEnable logging of network data
frame_rate_periodfloat660+nosecsThe frame rate period. Use the reciprocal to get the frame rate (e.g. 1/mnw.prd)
time_ratiofloat660+nosecsThis is how close XP time matches real time. Ideal ratio is 1. NOTE: in 930 and later time ratio is always 1.0.
+ sim/operation/override/

override_joystickint660+yesbooleanOverride control of the joystick deflections (overrides stick, yoke, pedals, keys, mouse, and auto-coordination)
override_artstabint660+yesbooleanOverride control of the artificial stability system
override_flightcontrolint660+yesbooleanOverride all parts of the flight system at once
override_gearbrakeint660+yesbooleanOverride gear and brake status
override_planepathint[20]660+yesbooleanOverride position updates of this plane
override_plane_ai_autopilotint[20]860+yesbooleanOverride the AI's control of the plane via the autopilot
override_navneedlesint660+yesbooleanOverride navcom radios
override_nav1_needlesint930+yesbooleanOverride nav1 receiver
override_nav2_needlesint930+yesbooleanOverride nav2 receiver
override_adfint660+yesbooleanOverride ADF radios
override_dmeint660+yesbooleanOverride DME distances
override_gpsint660+yesbooleanOverride GPS computer
override_nav_headingint940+yesbooleanOverride raw heading flown by nav (for GPS that fly by roll commands)
override_flightdirint660+yesbooleanOverride flight director needles (both axes)
override_flightdir_ptchint810+yesbooleanOverride flight director needles (pitch only)
override_flightdir_rollint810+yesbooleanOverride flight director needles (roll only)
override_cameraint660+yesbooleanOverride camera control. NOTE: DO NOT USE, USE XPLMCAMERA!!
override_annunciatorsint660+yesbooleanOverride annunciators
override_autopilotint710+yesbooleanOverride the autopilot's brains
override_pfc_autopilot_litesint710-811yesbooleanOverride partial control of a PFC jet cockpit (not for the faint at heart!)
override_joystick_headingint710+yesbooleanOverride just heading (yaw) control (disables auto-coordination). Use yoke_heading_ratio.
override_joystick_pitchint710+yesbooleanOverride just pitch control. Use yoke_pitch_ratio.
override_joystick_rollint710+yesbooleanOverride just roll control. Use yoke_roll_ratio.
override_throttlesint710+yesboolean Override the throttles. Use ENGN_thro_use to control them.
override_prop_pitchint930+yesbooleanOverride the prop pitch. Use POINT_pitch_deg_use to edit.
override_prop_modeint1030+yesbooleanOverride the prop mode. Use ENGN_propmode to edit.
override_mixtureint930+yesbooleanOverride the mixture controls. Use ENGN_mixt to edit.
override_groundplaneint740+yesbooleanOverride ground interactions (see sim/flightmodel/ground)
disable_cockpit_objectint750+yesbooleanDisable drawing of 3-d cockpit object
disable_twosided_fuselageint750+yesbooleanDisable drawing of 3-d cockpit object
override_fms_advanceint840+yesbooleanOverride the FMS going to the next waypoint.
override_fuel_flowint850+yesbooleanoverrides fuel flow variable sim/flightmodel/engine/ENGN_FF_
override_itt_egtint850+yesbooleanoverrides engine temp vars sim/flightmodel/engine/ENGN_EGT_c and ENGN_ITT_c
override_control_surfacesint850+yesbooleanoverrides individual control surfaces, e.g. sim/flightmodel/controls/lail1def
override_enginesint1000+yesbooleanoverrides all engine calculations - write to LMN and g_nrml/side/axil.
override_forcesint1000+yesbooleanoverrides all force calculations - write to LMN and g_nrml/side/axil.
override_boatsint[2]1025+yesbooleanoverrides speed, heading, and rocking of boats. index 0=carrier, 1=frigate
override_cloudsint1030+yesbooleanoverrides building and drawing of clouds as well as white-out-in-cloud effects
override_wheel_steerint1030+yesbooleanoverrides the steering of individual gear from tiller/rudder.

+ sim/operation/sound/

These are really the user's sound preference so: put them back when your plugin is done, and don't be shocked if some datarefs go away if the prefs change.

has_soundint660+nobooleanDoes this machine have sound hardware that X-Plane understands?
has_speech_synthint660+nobooleanDoes this machine have speech synth capabilities?
sound_onint660+yesbooleanIs sound on (set by user)
speech_onint660+yesbooleanIs speech synth on (set by user)
radio_chatter_onint740-999yesbooleanTurn off background radio chatter
master_sound_volumefloat740-899yes0-1Master audio level in X-Plane - broken in late v8, no master volume exists.
engine_volume_ratiofloat1030+yes0-1Volume level for engine sound effects, ratio from 0 (silent) to 1 (max loudness)
prop_volume_ratiofloat1030+yes0-1Volume level for propeller sound effects, ratio from 0 (silent) to 1 (max loudness)
ground_volume_ratiofloat1030+yes0-1Volume level for ground contact effects, ratio from 0 (silent) to 1 (max loudness)
weather_volume_ratiofloat1030+yes0-1Volume level for weather sound effects, ratio from 0 (silent) to 1 (max loudness)
warning_volume_ratiofloat1030+yes0-1Volume level for warning systems, ratio from 0 (silent) to 1 (max loudness)
radio_volume_ratiofloat1030+yes0-1Volume level for the com radios, ratio from 0 (silent) to 1 (max loudness)
fan_volume_ratiofloat1030+yes0-1Volume level for the avionics fan, ratio from 0 (silent) to 1 (max loudness)

cloud_type[0]int660+yesCloud enumerationThe type of clouds for this cloud layer.Currently there are only 3 cloud layers, 0, 1 or 2. Cloud types:

Clear = 0, High Cirrus = 1, Scattered = 2, Broken = 3, Overcast = 4, Stratus = 5 (740 and newer)

cloud_type[1]int660+yesCloud enumerationThe type of clouds for this cloud layer.Currently there are only 3 cloud layers, 0, 1 or 2. Cloud types:

Clear = 0, High Cirrus = 1, Scattered = 2, Broken = 3, Overcast = 4, Stratus = 5 (740 and newer)

Clear = 0, High Cirrus = 1, Scattered = 2, Broken = 3, Overcast = 4, Stratus = 5 (740 and newer)

wave_lengthint660+yesmetersLength of a single wave in the water
wave_speedint660+yesmeters/secondSpeed of water waves
wave_dirint660+yesdegreesDirection of waves.
temperature_sealevel_cint660+yesdegrees CThe temperature at sea level.
dewpoi_sealevel_cint660+yesdegrees CThe dew point at sea level.
temperature_ambient_cfloat660+nodegrees CThe air temperature outside the aircraft (at altitude).
temperature_le_cfloat660+nodegrees CThe air temperature at the leading edge of the wings in degrees C.
thermal_percentint660+yes[0.0 - 1.0]The percentage of thermal occurance in the area.
thermal_rate_msint660+yesm/s >= 0The climb rate for thermals.
thermal_altitude_msl_mint660+yesm MSL >= 0The top of thermals in meters MSL.
meteorite_densityfloat660-999yes??The density of meteorites in space.
runway_frictionint660+yes??The friction constant for runways (how wet they are).
wind_direction_degtfloat660+no[0-359)The effective direction of the wind at the plane's location.
wind_speed_ktfloat660+nokts >= 0The effective speed of the wind at the plane's location.
wind_now_x_mscfloat930+nometers/secWind direction vector in OpenGL coordinates, X component.
wind_now_y_mscfloat930+nometers/secWind direction vector in OpenGL coordinates, Y component.
wind_now_z_mscfloat930+nometers/secWind direction vector in OpenGL coordinates, Z component.
precipitation_on_aircraft_ratiofloat1000+no[0..1]The amount of rain on the airplane windshield as a ratio from 0 to 1.
+ sim/world/

+ sim/world/boat/

velocity_mscfloat[2]1025+yesmeters/secVelocity of the boat in meters per second in its current direction. Index 0=carrier,1=frigate, writable using override_boats.
x_mtrfloat[2]1025+yesmetersX Position of the boat in meters in the local coordinate OpenGL coordinate system. Index 0=carrier,1=frigate, writable using override_boats.
y_mtrfloat[2]1025+yesmetersY Position of the boat in meters in the local coordinate OpenGL coordinate system. Index 0=carrier,1=frigate, writable using override_boats.
z_mtrfloat[2]1025+yesmetersZ Position of the boat in meters in the local coordinate OpenGL coordinate system. Index 0=carrier,1=frigate, writable using override_boats.
heading_degfloat[2]1025+yesdegrees(true)Heading of the boat in degrees from true north. Index 0=carrier,1=frigate, writable using override_boats.
pitch_frequency_hzfloat[2]1025+yeshzFrequency at which the boat pitches up and down. Index 0=carrier,1=frigate, writable using override_boats.
pitch_amplitude_deg_mtrfloat[2]1025+yesdeg/meterDegrees that the boat pitches up for each meter of wave height. Index 0=carrier,1=frigate, writable using override_boats.
roll_frequency_hzfloat[2]1025+yeshzFrequency at which the boat rolls from side to side. Index 0=carrier,1=frigate, writable using override_boats.
roll_amplitude_deg_mtrfloat[2]1025+yesdeg/meterdegrees that the boat rolls from side to side for each meter of wave height. Index 0=carrier,1=frigate, writable using override_boats.
frigate_deck_height_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersDeck height of the frigate (in coordinates of the OBJ model)
frigate_ILS_offset_x_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersX position of the frigate ILS transmitter (in coordinates of the OBJ model)
frigate_ILS_offset_z_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersZ position of the frigate ILS transmitter (in coordinates of the OBJ model)
carrier_deck_height_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersDeck height of the carrier (in coordinates of the OBJ model)
carrier_ILS_offset_x_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersX position of the carrier ILS transmitter (in coordinates of the OBJ model)
carrier_ILS_offset_z_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersZ position of the carrier ILS transmitter (in coordinates of the OBJ model)
carrier_approach_headingfloat1025+yesdegrees(true)Relative heading of the approach path from the carrier's heading
carrier_catshot_headingfloat1025+yesdegrees(true)Relative heading of the catshot relative to the carrier's heading
carrier_catshot_start_x_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersX position (in model coordinates) of the start of the cat-shot track
carrier_catshot_start_z_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersZ position (in model coordinates) of the start of the cat-shot track
carrier_catshot_end_x_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersX position (in model coordinates) of the end of the cat-shot track
carrier_catshot_end_z_mtrfloat1025+yesmetersZ position (in model coordinates) of the end of the cat-shot track
carrier_catshot_statusint1025+noenum0=no cat shot set up,1=cat shot waiting to launch,2=in progress
+ sim/world/winch/

winch_ramp_up_time_secfloat1030+yessecondsThis is how long it takes the winch to reach maximum speed for a glider winch take-off.
winch_speed_knotsfloat1030+yesknotsThis is how fast the winch moves at its maximum speed.
winch_initial_lengthfloat1030+yesmetersThis is the initial length of cable for a winch takeoff.
winch_max_bhpfloat1031+yesbhpThis is the maximum horsepower the winch can deliver reeling in the cable. Cable speed will decay with higher force on the cable to not exceed this limit.
+ sim/cockpit2/

This section contains datarefs useful for custom cockpits. Typically data is broken into indicators (what the pilot sees via instruments) and actuators (write to these to change what the plane does). The actuators may not work when a failure happens, and the indicators may show false readings. By using these datarefs, your cockpit will match the failure settings.

+ sim/cockpit2/annunciators/

Annunciators, all are essentially indications.

master_cautionint900+nobooleanThis goes off any time there is a major problem with the bird: like it is on fire or something // array of annunciators... kept as array for UDP IO
master_warningint900+nobooleanThis goes off whenever there is some more moderate problem with the bird... maybe lo fuel pressure ot qty
master_acceptint900+nobooleanHit this button to CLEAR the master caution and warning: it says that you hear the buzzer and to shut it up already
autopilot_disconnectint900+nobooleanThis goes off for a few moments when the autopilot disconnects.. you wanna KNOW if otto just quit on you!
low_vacuumint900+nobooleanThe vacuum pressure, which drives the instruments in the old prop planes, is low: the artificial horizon may loose it is orientation!
low_voltageint900+nobooleanThe voltage os too high or low on one of the electrical buses
fuel_quantityint900+nobooleanFuel qty. no points for guessing if it is too high or too low to trigger this one
hydraulic_pressureint900+nobooleanHydraulic pressure. should indicate if press is lo or hi
speedbrakeint900+nobooleanSpeedbrake deployed: good to know so you do not forget it..
GPWSint900+nobooleanGround proximity warning system: PULL UP! PULL UP! my lancair does this during my typical red-baron approaches!
iceint900+nobooleanIce detected on the plane.. most people agree this is NOT a good thing.
low_rotorint900+nobooleanRotor rpm on the helo has dropped below normal operating: power availability will be reduced!
high_rotorint900+nobooleanRotor rpm on the helo has exceeded normal operating: power availability will be reduced, and god knows if the blades will stay ON!
pitot_heatint900+nobooleanPitot heat is OFF (YUP! OFF!) turn it on to heat up the pitot tube, which measures air pressure to give you air speed.
transonicint900+nobooleanYou are about to break the speed of sound when accelerating, or drop below the speed of sound if decelerating! the handling of the plane will change!
slatsint900+nobooleanslats deployed
flight_directorint900+nobooleanflight director failure
autopilotint900+nobooleanautopilot failure
yaw_damperint900+nobooleanyaw damper failure
fuel_pressure_lowint[8]930+nobooleanfuel pressure low - per engine
oil_pressure_lowint[8]930+nobooleanfuel pressure low - per engine
oil_temperature_highint[8]930+nobooleanoil temperature high - per engine
generator_offint[8]930+nobooleangenerator off - per engine
chip_detectedint[8]930+nobooleanchip detected - per engine
engine_firesint[8]930+nobooleanengine fire - per engine
igniter_onint[8]930+nobooleanigniter on - per engine
reverser_onint[8]930+nobooleanreverser on - per engine
burner_onint[8]930+nobooleanburner on - per engine
inverter_offint[2]930+nobooleaninverter off - per 2 inverters
N1_lowint[8]930+nobooleanN1 of engine is too low for AC - per engine
N1_highint[8]930+nobooleanN1 too high - per engine
reverser_not_readyint[8]930+nobooleanreversers not ready
ice_vane_extendint[8]930+nobooleanice vain extended (per engine)
ice_vane_failint[8]930+nobooleanice vain failed (per engine)
bleed_air_offint[8]930+nobooleanbleed air off (per engine)
bleed_air_failint[8]930+nobooleanbleed air failed (per engine)
auto_feather_armint[8]930+nobooleanauto feather armed (per engine)
fuel_transferint[9]930+nobooleanfuel transfer on (per tank)
hvacint930+nobooleanduct overheated
battery_charge_hiint930+nobooleanbattery is charging too rapidly - may overheat
cabin_altitude_12500int930+nobooleancabin altitude at or above 12500
autopilot_trim_failint930+nobooleanautopilot trim failure
electric_trim_offint930+nobooleanelectric trim is off
crossfeed_onint930+nobooleancrossfeed on
landing_taxi_liteint930+nobooleanlanding or taxiway light on but gear up
cabin_door_openint930+nobooleancabin door is open
external_power_onint930+nobooleanexternal power is on
passenger_oxy_onint930+nobooleanpassenger oxygen on
brake_deice_onint930-1003nobooleanbrake de-icing on
gear_unsafeint930+nobooleangear is unsafe
autopilot_trim_downint930+nobooleanautopilot trimming down
autopilot_trim_upint930+nobooleanautopilot trimming up
autopilot_bank_limitint930+nobooleanautopilot bank limit is turned ON, autopilot will keep bank below 12.5 degrees of bank
autopilot_soft_rideint930+nobooleanautopilot soft ride is on
no_invertersint930+nobooleanno inverters are on
fuel_pressureint900+nobitfieldFuel pressure is lo, or maybe hi, for this engine // x8
oil_pressureint900+nobitfieldOil pressure is lo, or maybe hi, for this engine // x8
oil_temperatureint900+nobitfieldOil temperature hi for this engine // x8
generatorint900+nobitfieldThe generator has failed! the plane cannot charge up. this may happen at lo rpm and go away as the engine revs. happens with my plane // x8
chip_detectint900+nobitfieldWe detected chips of metal in the engine somewhere. most people agree this is not good. // x8
engine_fireint900+nobitfieldThe engine is on FIRE! this adds to excitement // x8
auto_ignitionint900-902nobitfieldThe jet or turbine engine has the igniter CONSTANTLY ON, being sure to keep the fire burning even if rain gets in there or something. // x8
reverser_deployedint900+nobitfieldThrust-reverse deployed! // x8
afterburnerint900+nobitfieldAfterburners on! // x8
inverterint900+nobitfieldThe inverter has failed! the plane cannot convert ac from the generators to dc for the instruments. // x2
stall_warningint900+nobooleanStall warning going off, yes or no.
gear_warningint900+nobooleanGear warning going off, yes or no.
no_smokingint900+nobooleanNo smoking alert on, yes or no.
fasten_seatbeltint900+nobooleanSeatbelt sign on, yes or no.
+ sim/cockpit2/autopilot/

autopilot_sourceint900+yesenumAutopilot source system, pilots (0) or copilots (1).
autothrottle_enabledint900+yesbooleanAuto-throttle on, 0 or 1. This is the switch.
autothrottle_onint930+nobooleanAuto-throttle really working? Takes into account failures, esys, etc.
heading_modeint900+noenumAutopilot heading mode.
altitude_modeint900+noenumAutopilot altitude mode.
bank_angle_modeint900+yesenumMaximum bank angle mode, 0->6. Higher number is steeper allowable bank.
flight_director_modeint900+yesenumFlight director mode, 0 is off, 1 is on, 2 is on with autopilot servos. Good for the FD swich.
autopilot_onint930+nobooleanIs the autopilot really on? Takes into account electrical system, failures, etc.;
servos_onint930+nobooleanAre the servos on? Takes into account FD mode and control-wheel-steering, failures, etc.
airspeed_is_machint900+yesbooleanAutopilot airspeed is Mach number rather than knots.
alt_vvi_is_showing_vviint940+yesbooleanIs the combined alt/vvi selector showing VVI?
vnav_armedint900+nobooleanVnav is armed, 0 or 1 - this is different from the "FMS" button.
altitude_hold_armedint900+nobooleanAltitude is armed, 0 or 1.
hnav_armedint900+nobooleanLocalizer is armed, 0 or 1.
glideslope_armedint900+nobooleanGlideslope is armed, 0 or 1.
backcourse_onint900+nobooleanBack course is armed, 0 or 1.
airspeed_dial_kts_machfloat900+yesknots/machAirspeed hold value, knots or Mach depending on km_is_mach.

heading_dial_deg_mag_copilotfloat900+yesdegrees_magneticHeading hold commanded, in degrees magnetic.
vvi_dial_fpmfloat900+yesfeet/minuteVVI commanded in FPM.
altitude_dial_ftfloat900+yesfeetVVI commanded in FPM.
altitude_hold_ftfloat900+nofeetAltitude hold commanded in feet indicated.
altitude_vnav_ftfloat900+nofeetTarget altitude hold in VNAV mode.
sync_hold_pitch_degfloat900+yesdegreesPitch-hold commanded in degrees up.
sync_hold_roll_degfloat900+yesdegreesRoll-hold commanded in degrees right.
flight_director_pitch_degfloat900+nodegreesFlight director pitch deflection in degrees, pos up.
flight_director_roll_degfloat900+nodegreesFlight director roll deflection in degrees, pos right.
TOGA_pitch_degfloat1030+yesdegreesNose-up pitch to hold when TOGA operations are in effect. Set this back when your aircraft unloads!
roll_statusint930+noenumAutopilot Roll-Hold Status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured
heading_statusint930+noenumAutopilot Heading Status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured
nav_statusint930+noenumAutopilot Nav Status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured
backcourse_statusint930+noenumAutopilot Back-course Status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured

vvi_statusint930+noenumAutopilot VVI Status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured

altitude_hold_statusint930+noenumAutopilot Altitude hold status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured

vnav_statusint930+noenumAutopilot VNAV status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured
TOGA_statusint930+noenumAutopilot TOGA vertical (go-around) status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured
approach_statusint930+noenumAutopilot approach status. 0=off,1=armed,2=captured

+ sim/cockpit2/controls/

All of the controls are effectivley actuators.

yoke_pitch_ratiofloat900+yes-1..1This is how much the yoke is deflected in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.
yoke_roll_ratiofloat900+yes-1..1This is how much the yoke is deflected in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
yoke_heading_ratiofloat900+yes-1..1This is how much the rudder is deflected in the cockpit, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
speedbrake_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is how much the speebrake HANDLE is deflected, in ratio, where 0.0 is fully retracted, 0.5 is halfway down, and 1.0 is fully down, and -0.5 is speedbrakes ARMED.
wingsweep_ratiofloat900+yesratioRequested sweep, in ratio. 0.0 is no sweep requested, 1 is max sweep requested.
thrust_vector_ratiofloat900+yesratioRequested thrust vector, in ratio. 0.0 is no thrust vector requested, 1 is max thrust vector requested.
dihedral_ratiofloat900+yesratioRequested dihedral, in ratio. 0.0 is no dihedral requested, 1 is max dihedral requested.
incidence_ratiofloat900+yesratioRequested incidence, in ratio. 0.0 is no incidence requested, 1 is max incidence requested.
wing_retraction_ratiofloat900+yesratioRequested wing-retraction, in ratio. 0.0 is no wing-retraction requested, 1 is max wing-retraction requested.
flap_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is the flap HANDLE location, in ratio, where 0.0 is handle fully retracted, and 1.0 is handle fully extended.
parking_brake_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is the overall brake requested by the parking brake button... 0.0 is none, 1.0 is complete.
left_brake_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is additional left brake requested by pedal deflection, 0.0 to 1.0.
right_brake_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is additional right brake requested by pedal deflection, 0.0 to 1.0.
gear_handle_downint900+yesbooleanGear handle position. 0 is up. 1 is down.
nosewheel_steer_onint900+yesbooleanIs the nosewheel steering turned on? 0 or 1. This must be off AND the tail wheel must be unlocked to free castor.
tailwheel_lock_ratiofloat900+yesratioTail-wheel lockig ratio. 0 for free-castoring, 1 for totally locked.
aileron_trimfloat900+yes-1..1Aileron trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the aileron trim is deflected enough to move the ailerons through 30% of their travel, then that is an aileron trim of 0.3. -1=left 1=right
elevator_trimfloat900+yes-1..1Elevator trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the elevator trim is deflected enough to move the elevators through 30% of their travel, then that is an elevator trim of 0.3. -1=down 1=up
rudder_trimfloat900+yes-1..1Rudder trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rudder trim is deflected enough to move the rudders through 30% of their travel, then that is an rudder trim of 0.3. -1=left 1=right
rotor_trimfloat900+yes-1..1Rotor trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rotor trim is deflected enough to move the rotor through 30% of its travel, then that is a rotor trim of 0.3. -1=down 1=up
water_rudder_handle_ratiofloat901+yesratioDeployment of the water rudder, 0 is none, 1 is max
flap_handle_deploy_ratiofloat920+noratioThis is how far the indicator of flap deployment has moved in the cockpit.
+ sim/cockpit2/EFIS/

EFIS controls - all actuators.

map_modeint900+yesenumMap mode. 0=approach, 1=vor,2=map,3=nav,4=plan
map_mode_is_HSIint900+yesbooleanMap is in HSI mode, 0 or 1.
map_rangeint900+yesenumMap range, 1->6, where 6 is the longest range.
argus_modeint900+yesenumArgus mode, 7=departure,8=enroute,9=approach,10=radar_on
ecam_modeint900+yesenumECAM mode, 0=engine,1=fuel,2=controls,3=hydraulics,4=failures
EFIS_weather_onint900+yesbooleanOn the moving map, show the weather or not.
EFIS_tcas_onint900+yesbooleanOn the moving map, show the TCAS or not.
EFIS_airport_onint900+yesbooleanOn the moving map, show the airports or not.
EFIS_fix_onint900+yesbooleanOn the moving map, show the fixes or not.
EFIS_vor_onint900+yesbooleanOn the moving map, show the VORs or not.
EFIS_ndb_onint900+yesbooleanOn the moving map, show the NDBs or not.
EFIS_1_selection_pilotint900+yesenumEFIS waypoint 1 is showing: 0=ADF1, 1=OFF, or 2=VOR1 -- Pilot
EFIS_1_selection_copilotint900+yesenumEFIS waypoint 2 is showing: 0=ADF1, 1=OFF, or 2=VOR1 -- Copilot
EFIS_2_selection_pilotint900+yesenumEFIS waypoint 1 is showing: 0=ADF2, 1=OFF, or 2=VOR2 -- Pilot
EFIS_2_selection_copilotint900+yesenumEFIS waypoint 2 is showing: 0=ADF2, 1=OFF, or 2=VOR2 -- Copilot
EFIS_pageint[6]900+yesbooleanAn array of EFIS page switches for selecting which EFIS page is visible.

plugin_bus_load_ampsfloat[6]1030+yesampsAdd additional load to this dataref to create additional custom bus loads.
panel_brightness_ratiofloat[4]930+noratioThis is the actual panel brightness, taking into account failures
panel_brightness_ratio_autofloat[4]1000+noratioThis is the actual panel brightness, taking into account failures
panel_brightness_ratio_manualfloat[4]1000+noratioThis is the actual panel brightness, taking into account failures
instrument_brightness_ratiofloat[16]930+noratioActual instrument brightness, taking into account failures
instrument_brightness_ratio_autofloat[16]1000+noratioActual instrument brightness, taking into account failures
instrument_brightness_ratio_manualfloat[16]1000+noratioActual instrument brightness, taking into account failures
HUD_brightness_ratiofloat930+noratioActual HUD brightness, taking into account failures
HUD_brightness_ratio_autofloat1000+noratioActual HUD brightness, taking into account failures
HUD_brightness_ratio_manualfloat1000+noratioActual HUD brightness, taking into account failures
+ sim/cockpit2/engine/

Engine cockpit datarefs

+ sim/cockpit2/engine/actuators/

Controls for each engine

cyclic_elevator_degfloat[engines]900+yesdegrees This is the longitudinal cyclic COMMAND, in degrees. Positive forwards cyclic.
cyclic_aileron_degfloat[engines]900+yesdegreesThis is the lateral cyclic COMMAND, in degrees. Positive right cyclic.
throttle_ratiofloat[engines]900+yesratio Throttle position of the handle itself, from 0.0 (idle) to 1.0 (max normal).
throttle_ratio_allfloat930+yesratioThrottle position of the handle itself - this controls all the handles at once.
prop_rotation_speed_rad_secfloat[engines]900+yesradians/second Prop handle position, in radians per second of requested prop rpm. Use this if your plane has a constant speedprop.
prop_rotation_speed_rad_sec_allfloat930+yesradians/secondProp handle position, this controls all props at once.
prop_angle_degreesfloat[engines]930+yesdegreesProp handle position, in degrees. Use this if your plane has a manual-adjust prop.
prop_angle_degrees_allfloat930+yesdegreesProp handle position, in degrees, set all at once.
mixture_ratiofloat[engines]900+yesratio Mixture handle position, 0.0 (cutoff) to 1.0 (full rich).
mixture_ratio_allfloat930+yesratioMixture handle position, this controls all at once.
carb_heat_ratiofloat[engines]900+yesratio Carb-heat handle position, 0.0 (none) to 1.0 (full).
cowl_flap_ratiofloat[engines]900+yesratio Cowl-flap handle position, 0.0 (none) to 1.0 (full open).
primer_ratiofloat[engines]900+yesratio Primer handle position, 0.0 (none) to 1.0 (on).
afterburner_enabledint[engines]900+yesboolean Afterburner enabled, on or off.
igniter_onint[engines]900+yesboolean Igniter, on or off.
auto_ignite_onint[engines]920+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - auto-ignition. This switch turns on a continuous ignition source in the engine to automatically relight it if there is a flameout.
ignition_onint[engines]900+yesenum 0 = off, 1 = left, 2 = right, 3 = both
ignition_keyint[8]955+yesenum0 = off, 1 = left, 2 = right, 3 = both, 4 = starting
fadec_onint[engines]900+yesboolean Fadec, ok or off.
primer_onint[engines]900+yesboolean Primer button, on or off.
fuel_pump_onint[engines]900+yesboolean Fuel pump, on or off. This is the electric per-engine fuel pump!
idle_speedint[8]900+yesboolean Idle speed, hi=1 or lo=0.
prop_modeint[engines]900+yesenum This is the propeller and engine operation mode. It is used for props and jets. Mode 0 is feathered, 1 is normal, 2 is in beta, and reverse (prop or jet) is mode 3.
prop_pitch_degfloat[engines]900+yesdegrees This is the REQUESTED pitch of the prop in degrees from its flat-pitch setting.
governor_onint[engines]930+yesbooleanGovernor on-off switch.
fire_extinguisher_onint[engines]930+yesbooleanFire extinguisher on
clutch_engagefloat[8]1000+yes???Per engine clutch engage
clutch_ratiofloat[8]1000+yes???Per engine clutch ratio

Readings for each engine

N1_percentfloat[engines]900+nopercentN1, %.

torque_n_mtrfloat[engines]900+nonewton_metersTorque, NM.

oil_pressure_psifloat[engines]900+nopounds/square_inchOil pressure, psi.
oil_temperature_deg_Cfloat[engines]900+nodegrees_COil temp, deg.
oil_quantity_ratiofloat[engines]900+noratioOil quantity, 0.0 to 1.0.
power_wattsfloat[engines]900+nowattsActual engine power output.
thrust_nfloat[engines]930+nonewtonsEngine thrust in Newtons

+ sim/cockpit2/hydraulics/

Actuators for ice switches

+ sim/cockpit2/hydraulics/indicators/

hydraulic_pressure_1float930+noanyHydraulic system 1 pressure, units set by Plane-Maker.
hydraulic_pressure_2float930+noanyHydraulic system 2 pressure, units set by Plane-Maker.
hydraulic_fluid_ratio_1float930+noratioHydraulic fluid quantity, ratio of max, system 1
hydraulic_fluid_ratio_2float930+noratioHydraulic fluid quantity, ratio of max, system 2
+ sim/cockpit2/ice/

Actuators for ice switches

ice_all_onint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - all systems. This is the master switch for the de-icing systems.
ice_inlet_heat_onint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - inlet heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the engine air inlet keep ice from choking your engine. Engine 1 only
ice_prop_heat_onint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - prop heat. This switch turns on de-icing of the propeller(s) to keep ice from building up on your prop. Engine 1 only
ice_inlet_heat_on_per_engineint[8]1020+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - inlet heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the engine air inlet keep ice from choking your engine. Per engine
ice_prop_heat_on_per_engineint[8]1020+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - prop heat. This switch turns on de-icing of the propeller(s) to keep ice from building up on your prop. Per engine
ice_window_heat_onint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - windshield heat. This switch turns on windshield de-icing to keep ice from blocking your vision.
ice_pitot_heat_on_pilotint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - pitot tube heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the pitot tube. If it freezes up your airspeed indicator and altimeter stop working. Airspeed and altitude related autopilot functions are also affected.
ice_pitot_heat_on_copilotint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. Pitot tube heat, co-pilot. This switch turns on de-icing heat in the co-pilot side pitot tube. If it freezes up your airspeed indicator and altimeter stop working. Airspeed and altitude related autopilot functions are also affected.
ice_AOA_heat_onint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. AOA sensor heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the AOA sensor. If it freezes up your AOA indicator stops working. AOA sensor failure will also affect the aircraft's artificial stability system if it has one. Pilot.
ice_AOA_heat_on_copilotint1020+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. AOA sensor heat. This switch turns on de-icing heat for the AOA sensor. If it freezes up your AOA indicator stops working. AOA sensor failure will also affect the aircraft's artificial stability system if it has one. Copilot.
ice_surfce_heat_onint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the wing leading edges to keep them free of ice. (All wings)
ice_surfce_heat_left_onint930+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the wing leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Left wing)
ice_surfce_heat_right_onint930+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - bleed air. This switch directs warm air from the engines into the wing leading edges to keep them free of ice. (Right wing)
ice_surface_boot_onint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - pneumatic. This switch inflates flexible bladders on the wing leading edges to pop off accumulated ice.
anti_ice_engine_airfloat[engines]900+yesratioDe-Ice ratio. (Description needed)
anti_ice_engine_air_bfloat[engines]900+yesratioDe-Ice ratio. (Description needed)
ice_auto_ignite_onint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. De-ice - auto-ignition. This switch turns on a continuous ignition source in the engine to automatically relight it if there is a flameout.
ice_detect_onint900+yesbooleanDe-ice switch, 0 or 1. Ice-detection: Turn this switch on to enable ice-detection... if the system detects ice, it will light up the ICE annunciator.
+ sim/cockpit2/pressurization/

Control for cabin pressurization

+ sim/cockpit2/pressurization/actuators/

bleed_air_modeint900+yesenumBleed air mode, 0=of, 1=left,2=both,3=right,4=apu,5=auto
dump_all_onint900+yesbooleanDump all pressurization, 0 or 1.
dump_to_altitude_onint900+yesfeetDump pressurization to the current altitude, 0 or 1.
cabin_altitude_ftfloat900+yesfeetCabin altitude commanded, feet.
cabin_vvi_fpmfloat900+yesfeet/minuteCabin VVI commanded, feet.
max_allowable_altitude_ftfloat900+yesfeetMaximum allowable altitude for this airplane to maintain the requested cabin altitude.

cabin_vvi_fpmfloat900+nofeet/minuteCabin VVI actually occurring, fpm.
pressure_diffential_psifloat900+nopounds/square_inchCabin differential pressure, psi.

gps_relative_bearing_degfloat900+nodegreesIndicated relative bearing to the selected GPS 1 destination
gps2_relative_bearing_degfloat1030+nodegreesIndicated relative bearing to the selected GPS 2 destination
nav1_flag_from_to_pilotint900+noenumNav-To-From indication, nav1, pilot, 0 is flag, 1 is to, 2 is from.
nav2_flag_from_to_pilotint900+noenumNav-To-From indication, nav2, pilot, 0 is flag, 1 is to, 2 is from.
nav_flag_from_to_pilotint[10]1040+noenumNav-To-From indication, navN, pilot, 0 is flag, 1 is to, 2 is from.

middle_marker_litint900+yesbooleanMarker light actually lit, 0 or 1. This flashes as we go over.
inner_marker_litint900+yesbooleanMarker light actually lit, 0 or 1. This flashes as we go over.

nav1_relative_heading_vacuum_deg_pilotfloat1030+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav1 OBS to the vacuum driven gyro for the pilot.
nav1_relative_heading_vacuum_deg_copilotfloat1030+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav1 OBS to the vacuum driven gyro for the copilot.

nav1_relative_heading_electric_deg_copilotfloat1030+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav1 OBS to the electric gyro for the copilot.

nav1_relative_heading_AHARS_deg_copilotfloat1030+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav1 OBS to AHARS for the copilot.

nav2_relative_heading_vacuum_deg_copilotfloat1030+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav2 OBS to the vacuum driven gyro for the copilot.

nav2_relative_heading_electric_deg_copilotfloat1030+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav2 OBS to the electric gyro for the copilot.

nav2_relative_heading_AHARS_deg_copilotfloat1030+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav2 OBS to AHARS for the copilot.

nav_relative_heading_vacuum_deg_copilotfloat[10]1040+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav N OBS to the vacuum driven gyro for the copilot.
nav_relative_heading_electric_deg_pilotfloat[10]1040+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav N OBS to the electric gyro for the pilot.
nav_relative_heading_electric_deg_copilotfloat[10]1040+nodegreesThis is the relative heading of the nav N OBS to the electric gyro for the copilot.

+ sim/cockpit2/switches/

These are all actuators.

avionics_power_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
navigation_lights_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
beacon_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
strobe_lights_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
landing_lights_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1. This affects the first landing light.
landing_lights_switchfloat[16]900+yesratioSwitch, 0 is off, 0.5 is half-intensity, etc. for any of the landing lights.
generic_lights_switchfloat[64]940+yesratioSwitch, 0 is off, 0.5 is half-intensity, etc. for any of the generic lights.
taxi_light_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
spot_light_onint1000+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
dump_fuelint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
puffers_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
prop_sync_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
jet_sync_modeint900+yesenumSwitch, 0 or 1. fan=0, off=1, turbine=2#WHAT ARE THESE?
electric_hydraulic_pump_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1. electric hydro-pressure pump
ram_air_turbine_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1. ram air turbine (the rat) when total failure
yaw_damper_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
artificial_stability_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
artificial_stability_pitch_onint930+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
artificial_stability_roll_onint930+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
HUD_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
parachute_deployint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
jato_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
tailhook_deployint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
canopy_openint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
door_openint[10]1041+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1. 0 is closed, 1 is open
water_scoop_deployint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
dump_waterint900+yesbooleanThis will be set to true when water is in the process of dumping out of a water-bomber.
no_smokingint900+yesbooleanNo Smoking
fasten_seat_beltsint900+yesboolean Fasten Seat Belts
total_energy_audioint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
HSI_is_arcint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
auto_brake_levelint900+yesenumSwitch, 0 is RTO (Rejected Take-Off), 1 is off, 2->5 are increasing auto-brake levels.
auto_reverse_onint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
prop_feather_modeint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
pre_rotate_levelint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1.
clutch_engageint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1 - engage/disengage rotor clutch
rotor_brakeint900+yesbooleanSwitch, 0 or 1 - turns on the rotor brake.
rotor_brake_ratiofloat1030+yesratioThis is the relative strength of the rotor brake compared to X-Plane default.
clutch_ratiofloat900+yesratioCurrent clutch ratio, 0.0 is off, 1.0 is on - follows clutch engage with some lag.
rocket_modeint900+yesenumThis will have an enumeration based on the direction of fire of any maneuvering rockets.
burner_levelint900+yesenumThis can be 0 (half-power afterburners) or 1 (full-power burner).
alternate_static_air_ratiofloat900+yesratioAlternate static air ratio, 0.0 is off, 1,.0 is on.
wiper_speedint900+yesenum0=off,1=25%speed,2=50%speed,3=100%speed.
custom_slider_onint[24]900+yesbooleancustom sliders. When flipped, slider moves based on timing in planemaker.
panel_brightness_ratiofloat[4]920+yesratioRheostat controlling panel brightness. 0 = flood, 1-3 = spot lights.
instrument_brightness_ratiofloat[16]920+yesratioRheostat controlling instruments brightnesss. 0 = default pilot, 1 = default copilot, 2-15 = custom
HUD_brightness_ratiofloat920+yesratioRheostat controlling HUD brightness.
camera_power_onint930+yesbooleanCamera power on
total_energy_audio_onint930+yesbooleanVariometer audio on
+ sim/cockpit2/tcas/

+ sim/cockpit2/tcas/indicators/

relative_bearing_degsfloat[20]930+nodegreesRelative bearing of each other plane in degrees for TCAS
relative_distance_mtrsfloat[20]930+nometersDistance to each other plane in meters for TCAS
relative_altitude_mtrsfloat[20]930+nometersRelative altitude (positive means above us) for TCAS
+ sim/cockpit2/temperature/

outside_air_temp_degfloat930+nodegreesoutside air temperature, pilot selects units
outside_air_temp_degcfloat930+nodegreesCoutside air temperature, celsius
outside_air_temp_degffloat930+nodegreesFoutside air temperature, fahrenheit
outside_air_LE_temp_degfloat930+nodegreesoutside air temperature with leading edge, pilot selects units
outside_air_LE_temp_degcfloat930+nodegreesCoutside air temperature with leading edge, celsius
outside_air_LE_temp_degffloat930+nodegreesFoutside air temperature with leading edge, fahrenheit
outside_air_temp_is_metricint930+noboolean1 if thermo is metric, 0 if fahrenheit.
+ sim/cockpit2/transmissions/

+ sim/cockpit2/transmissions/indicators/

oil_temperaturefloat930+noanyTransmission oil temperature. Units are the same as the max oil temperature in ACF file.
oil_pressurefloat930+noanyTransmission oil pressure. Units are the same as the max oil pressure in ACF file.
+ sim/cockpit2/weapons/

weapon_select_console_indexint900+yesindexWeapon index selected on the weapon console.
fire_modeint900+yesenumWeapon fire-mode, 0=single, 1=pair, 2=ripple, 3=salvo.
fire_rateint900+yesenumWeapon fire-rate, 0, 1, 2, 3 depending on fire rate.
weapon_selectedint900+yesenumSwitch position for each weapon-arming switch (there can be several). These are the rotaries that can be dialed up or down to select various systems.
+ sim/flightmodel2/

The flightmodel2 section contains data about how the actual aircraft is being drawn. Use this section to build animated objects for the aircraft. Do not use these datarefs in the cockpit.

+ sim/flightmodel2/controls/

This section contains general control surface values for the whole plane. These are the actual control movements, e.g. if the control efficacy is reduced by low hydraulic pressure, these show what actually moved, not what the pilot wants.

pitch_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is how much the flight controls are deflected in pitch after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full down, and 1.0 is full up.
roll_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is how much the flight controls are deflected in roll after any stability augmentation, in ratio, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
heading_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is how much the flight controls are deflected in heading after any stability augmentation, where -1.0 is full left, and 1.0 is full right.
speedbrake_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is how much the speedbrakes surfaces are extended, in ratio, where 0.0 is fully retracted, and 1.0 is fully extended.
wingsweep_ratiofloat900+yesratioActual sweep, in ratio. 0.0 is no sweep deployment, 1 is max sweep deployment.
thrust_vector_ratiofloat900+yesratioActual thrust vector, in ratio. 0.0 is no thrust vector deployment, 1 is max thrust vector deployment.
dihedral_ratiofloat900+yesratioActual dihedral, in ratio. 0.0 is no dihedral deployment, 1 is max dihedral deployment.
incidence_ratiofloat900+yesratioActual incidence, in ratio. 0.0 is no incidence deployment, 1 is max incidence deployment.
wing_retraction_ratiofloat900+yesratioActual wing-retraction, in ratio. 0.0 is no wing-retraction deployment, 1 is max wing-retraction deployment.
flap_handle_deploy_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is the ACTUAL FLAP deployment for overall flap system, in ratio, where 0.0 is flaps fully retracted, and 1.0 is flaps fully extended. You should probably use the deployment for flap set 1 or flap set 2 to deflect the surfaces though. This takes into account that flaps deploy slowly, not instantaneously as the handle is dragged.
slat1_deploy_ratiofloat900+yesratioSlat deployment, where 0.0 is slats fully retracted, 1.0 is slats fully extended. This variable applies to lading-edge flaps as well.
slat2_deploy_ratiofloat900+yesratioSlat deployment, where 0.0 is slats fully retracted, 1.0 is slats fully extended. This variable applies to lading-edge flaps as well.
flap1_deploy_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is the ACTUAL FLAP deployment for flap-set #1, in ratio, where 0.0 is flaps fully retracted, and 1.0 is flaps fully extended.
flap2_deploy_ratiofloat900+yesratioThis is the ACTUAL FLAP deployment for flap-set #2, in ratio, where 0.0 is flaps fully retracted, and 1.0 is flaps fully extended.
stabilizer_deflection_degreesfloat900+yesdegreesThis is the actual stabilizer deflection with trim for all-moving horizontal stabilizers. This is the deflection you can see visually on airliners. This is in degrees, positive for leading-edge nose up.
aileron_trimfloat900+yesratioAileron trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the aileron trim is deflected enough to move the ailerons through 30% of their travel, then that is an aileron trim of 0.3.
elevator_trimfloat900+yesratioElevator trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the elevator trim is deflected enough to move the elevators through 30% of their travel, then that is an elevator trim of 0.3.
rudder_trimfloat900+yesratioRudder trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rudder trim is deflected enough to move the rudders through 30% of their travel, then that is an rudder trim of 0.3.
rotor_trimfloat900+yesratioRotor trim, in part of MAX FLIGHT CONTROL DEFLECTION. So, if the rotor trim is deflected enough to move the rotor through 30% of its travel, then that is a rotor trim of 0.3.
water_rudder_deploy_ratiofloat901+noratioDeployment of the water rudder, 0 is none, 1 is max
+ sim/flightmodel2/doors/

Landing gear doors.

typeint[doors]900+noenumeration0=unused (plane does not use this door) 1=standard (opens before gear goes down) 2=attached to strut (cycles with door), 3=closed (opens before gear goes down, then closes again)
location_x_mtrint[doors]900+nometersGear door location, in meters, x, y z.
location_y_mtrint[doors]900+nometersGear door location, in meters, x, y z.
location_z_mtrint[doors]900+nometersGear door location, in meters, x, y z.
axis_rotation_degfloat[doors]900+nodegreesAxis of rotation of this gear door, degrees.
angle_now_degfloat[doors]900+nodegreesCurrent angle about the axis of rotation of this gear door, degrees.
+ sim/flightmodel2/engines/

Datarefs for the physical engines, props and rotors.

location_x_mtrfloat[engines]900+nometersEngine location, meters x, y, z, with respect to the default center of gravity.
location_y_mtrfloat[engines]900+nometers Engine location, meters x, y, z, with respect to the default center of gravity.
location_z_mtrfloat[engines]900+nometers Engine location, meters x, y, z, with respect to the default center of gravity.
throttle_used_ratiofloat[engines]900+noratio Throttle that is actually going to the engine, which could be different than the commanded throttle due to FADEC throttle adjustments.
has_fuel_flow_before_mixtureint[engines]900+nobooleanEngine has fuel making to the mixture control, yes or no.
has_fuel_flow_after_mixtureint[engines]900+nobooleanEngine has fuel making to the combustion process, yes or no.
engine_is_burning_fuelint[engines]900+nobooleanEngine is currently burning fuel, yes or no.
engine_fuel_in_intakefloat[engines]1031+noratioHow much fuel has been primed into the intake port (fuel-injected engine) 0..1
engine_burning_fuel_ratioint[engines]900-902noratioEngine running ratio, 0.0 for not running to 1.0 for fully running, combustion process fully started.
afterburner_onint[engines]900+nobooleanAfterburner on, yes or no.
afterburner_ratiofloat[engines]900+noratioAfterburner engaged ratio, 0.0 to 1.0.
engine_rotation_speed_rad_secfloat[engines]900+noradians/second Rotational speed of the engine, in radians persecond.
engine_rotation_angle_degfloat[engines]900+nodegreesThis is the angle of the engine as it turns over, running 0 to 360 over and over again in normal operation. Engine speed can be different than prop rotation speed in clutched designs. This is radians per second.
prop_rotation_speed_rad_secfloat[engines]900+noradians/secondRadians per second rotation speed of the prop.
prop_rotation_angle_degfloat[engines]900+yesdegrees This is the angle of the prop or engine-fan as it rotates. You will see this value circulate 0 to 360 degrees over and over as the engine runs and the prop or fan turns. Override witih /prop_disc/override per engine!
prop_pitch_degfloat[engines]900+nodegreesThis is the ACTUAL pitch of the prop in degrees from its flat-pitch setting.
prop_cone_angle_radfloat[engines]900+noradians This is the coning angle of the disc, in radians. Typically close to 0.0.
rotor_vertical_vector_degfloat[engines]900+nodegreesThis engine rotor-disc vertical vector, in degrees, where 0 is straight forwards, 90 is straight up.
rotor_vertical_cyclic_degfloat[engines]900+nodegreesThis engine rotor-disc longitudinal cyclic, in degrees, where -10 is 10 degrees forwards, 10 is 10 degrees aft.
rotor_side_cyclic_degfloat[engines]900+nodegreesThis engine rotor-disc lateral cyclic, in degrees, where -10 is 10 degrees left, 10 is 10 degrees right.
rotor_cyclic_elevator_tilt_degfloat[engines]900+nodegrees Longitudinal disc tilt from cyclic deflection.
rotor_cyclic_aileron_tilt_degfloat[engines]900+nodegrees Lateral disc tilt from cyclic deflection.
nacelle_vertical_angle_degfloat[engines]900+nodegrees This engine nacelle vertical vector, in degrees, where 0 is straight forwards, 90 is straight up.
thrust_reverser_deploy_ratiofloat[engines]900+noratioHow far the reverser doors/mechanism have traveled. 0 = fully stowed, 1.0 = fully deployed.
prop_is_discint[engines]930+yesbooleanIs the prop a disc now? Override with /prop_disc/override per engine!
prop_tip_deflection_degreesfloat[8]1000+nodegreesDegrees of deflection of a line from the crank shaft to the prop tip.
+ sim/flightmodel2/engines/prop_disc/

Datarefs for customizing prop disc visualization.

overrideint[engines]930+yesbooleanSet to 1 to control the prop disc from a plugin. Overrides all other variables in this section.
disc_widthfloat[engines]940+yesmetersIf larger than zero, the prop disc is actually two discs, with this separation at the root and no separation at the tip.
disc_sfloat[engines]940+yesoffsetOffset from left (in "slots") for the prop disc texture. Fractions blend horizontal images.
disc_tint[engines]940+yesoffsetOffset from bottom (in "slots") for the prop disc texture
disc_s_dimint[engines]940+yescountNumber of horizontal slots for the prop disc in the prop disc texture
disc_t_dimint[engines]940+yescountNumber of vertical slots for the prop disc in the prop disc texture
disc_alpha_frontfloat[engines]940+yesratioAlpha of prop disc when viewed from front. X-Plane interpolates as the view angle moves.
disc_alpha_sidefloat[engines]940+yesratioAlpha of prop disc when viewed of side.
disc_alpha_insidefloat[engines]940+yesratioRatio to multiply disc alpha when view is inside the airplane.
side_widthfloat[engines]940+yesmetersWidth of prop side image in meters. Height comes from prop radius.
side_length_ratiofloat[engines]940+yesratioRatio to scale the length of the side image. 1.0 = the real length of the prop.
side_anglefloat[engines]940+yesdegreesRotation angle of the side images now - allows side to rotate independently of disc, perhaps faster.
side_number_of_bladesint[engines]940+yescountNumber of side blades to draw. Should be at least 2!
side_is_billboardint[engines]940+yesbooleanIf true, prop side angle comes from billboarding logic - if false, it comes from side_angle dataref.
side_sfloat[engines]940+yesoffsetOffset from left (in "slots") for the prop disc texture. Fractions blend horizontal images.
side_tint[engines]940+yesoffsetOffset from bottom (in "slots") for the prop disc texture
side_s_dimint[engines]940+yescountNumber of horizontal slots for the prop side in the prop disc texture
side_t_dimint[engines]940+yescountNumber of vertical slots for the prop side in the prop disc texture
side_alpha_frontfloat[engines]940+yesratioAlpha of prop side when viewed from front. X-Plane interpolates as the view angle moves.
side_alpha_sidefloat[engines]940+yesratioAlpha of prop side when viewed of side.
side_alpha_insidefloat[engines]940+yesratioRatio to multiply side alpha when view is inside the airplane.
side_alpha_to_camerafloat[engines]940+yesratioA ratio to multiply side alpha when the rotor is extending toward the camera.
+ sim/flightmodel2/gear/

Datarefs for each landing of the gear.

gear_heading_degfloat[gear]900+nodegreesCurrent gear heading angle, degrees.
gear_pitch_degfloat[gear]900+nodegreesCurrent gear pitch angle, degrees.
gear_roll_degfloat[gear]900+nodegreesCurrent gear roll angle, degrees.
tire_steer_command_degfloat[gear]900+yesdegreesSteering command being sent to this gear, degrees positive right. This takes into account steering algorithms for big planes like 747, but does not free castoring and springiness. Writable in 1030. Override via override_wheel_steer
tire_steer_actual_degfloat[gear]900+yesdegreesSteering command actually enacted by the gear, degrees positive right. Writable in 1030. Override via override_wheel_steer
tire_vertical_deflection_mtrfloat[gear]900+nometersVertical deflection of this gear, meters.
tire_vertical_force_n_mtrfloat[gear]900+nonewton_metersVertical force on this gear, newtons.
tire_rotation_speed_rad_secfloat[gear]900+noradians/secondRotational speed of this tire, radians per second.
tire_rotation_angle_degfloat[gear]900+nodegreesTire rotation in degrees, running 0 to 360 over and over as it rolls.
deploy_ratiofloat[gear]900+noratioThis is how far down the landing gear is. 0=up, 1= down
eagle_claw_angle_degfloat[gear]1020+nodegreesAngle of eagle-claw landing gear now, degrees, per gear.
+ sim/flightmodel2/lights/

These datarefs tell the actual brightness of the various lights. These are float arrays because in the future all lights will be variable intensity, and more than one of each.

landing_lights_brightness_ratiofloat[16]930+noratioRatio of the brightness of the landing lights, 0 is off, 1 is max.
generic_lights_brightness_ratiofloat[64]940+noratioRatio of the brightness of the landing lights, 0 is off, 1 is max.
taxi_lights_brightness_ratiofloat[1]930+noratioRatio of the brightness of the taxi light, 0 is off, 1 is max.
spot_lights_brightness_ratiofloat[1]1000+noratioRatio of the brightness of the spot light, 0 is off, 1 is max.
nav_lights_brightness_ratiofloat[1]930+noratioRatio of the brightness of the nav lights, 0 is off, 1 is max.
beacon_brightness_ratiofloat[4]930+yesratioRatio of the brightness of the beacon, 0 is off, 1 is max. Use override_beacons_and_strobes
strobe_brightness_ratiofloat[4]930+yesratioRatio of the brightness of the strobe, 0 is off, 1 is max. Use override_beacons_and_strobes
spot_light_heading_degfloat[1]1010+yesdegreesHeading offset in degrees of the spot light from its default position, positive is right.
spot_light_pitch_degfloat[1]1010+yesdegreesPitch offset in degrees of the spot light from its default position, positive is up.
strobe_flash_nowint940+yesbooleanIs any strobe flashing right now?
override_beacons_and_strobesint940+yesbooleanoverride beacon and strobe control
+ sim/flightmodel2/misc/

Various animations for the aircraft model.

canopy_open_ratiofloat900+noratioCanopy position: 0 = closed, 1 = open
door_open_ratiofloat[10]1041+noratioHow open is the door, 0 = closed, 1 = open
tailhook_deploy_ratiofloat900+noratioTailhook position: 0 = up, 1 = down
water_scoop_deploy_ratiofloat900+noratioWater scoop position: 0 = up, 1 = down
water_drop_deploy_ratiofloat900+noratioWater drop door position: 0 = up, 1= down
wiper_angle_degfloat[4]900+nodegreescurrent angle of the wiper. range of motion is set in PlaneMaker.
custom_slider_ratiofloat[24]900+noratioMisc. traveling items for your use. You define the meaning.
pressure_outflow_ratiofloat900+noratioHow far is the pressure-outflow valve open? 0=closed, 1=open
AoA_angle_degreesfloat900+nodegreesAngle of attack probe. Positive means aircracft nose is above the flight path in aircraft coordinates.
yaw_string_anglefloat900+nodegreesdesc
yaw_string_airspeedfloat900+nokiasdesc
gforce_normalfloat900+notododesc
gforce_axilfloat900+notododesc
gforce_sidefloat900+notododesc
bouncer_xfloat[14]930+nometerslateral offset in meters from default for this bouncer
bouncer_yfloat[14]930+nometersvertical offset in meters from default for this bouncer
bouncer_zfloat[14]930+nometerslongitudinal offset in meters from default for this bouncer
bouncer_vxfloat[14]930+nometerslateral offset in meters from default for this bouncer
bouncer_vyfloat[14]930+nometersvertical offset in meters from default for this bouncer
bouncer_vzfloat[14]930+nometerslongitudinal offset in meters from default for this bouncer
+ sim/flightmodel2/wing/

Wing properties. These give you the most specific access to control surfaces (for example, these include variable flaps with roll and pitch). The wings are indexed as: wing 1 left, wing 1 right .. wing 4 left, wing 4 right, left hstab, right hstab, rudders 1 and 2, then the 20 misc wings, for 32 indices.

aileron1_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the aileron from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
aileron2_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the aileron from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
spoiler1_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the roll-spoilerfrom set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
spoiler2_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the roll-spoilerfrom set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
yawbrake_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the yaw-brake on this wing. A yaw-brake is a set of spoilers on the top and bottom of the wing that split open symmetrically to drag that wing aft and yaw the plane. They are used on the B-2, for example.
elevator1_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the elevator from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
elevator2_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the elevator from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
rudder1_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the rudder from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge right.
rudder2_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the rudder from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge right.
flap1_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the flap from set #1 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
flap2_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the flap from set #2 on this wing. Degrees, positive is trailing-edge down.
speedbrake1_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the speedbrakes from set #1 on this wing.
speedbrake2_degfloat[wings]900+yesdegreesDeflection of the speedbrakes from set #2 on this wing.
airfoil_sweep_increase_degfloat[wings]900-999yesdegreesThe sweep increase BEYOND DEFAULT of this wing... this would only have a non-zero value for planes like the F-14 which can sweep their wings.
airfoil_dihedral_increase_degfloat[wings]900-999yesdegreesThe dihedral increase BEYOND DEFAULT of this wing... this would only have a non-zero value for planes like the Navy F-4 which can fold up the outer wing panels.
wing_tip_deflection_degfloat[32]1000+nodegreesDegrees of deflection of a line from the wing root (extended to the plane centerline) to the tip.
